Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HYL (natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c; 26 variants)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 50% similarityfrog CPF-L2. Mol Wt:   1699.149; GRAVY: 0.55.Activity: HYL exhibited weak antimicrobial activity against several strains of pathogenic bacteria S. aureus (MIC 53-63 uM);  S. epidermidis (MIC 13 uM); E. coli (MIC 15 uM), P. aeruginosa 5482 (MIC 20-68 uM) and moderate activity against C. albicans (MIC 18 uM), but its hemo.lytic activity against human red blood cells was low (HL50 >400 uM). Updated 10/2016; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Nešuta O, Hexnerová R, Budešínský M, Slaninová J, Bednárová L, Hadravová R, Straka J, Veverka V, Cerovský V.2016
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial Peptide from the Wild Bee Hylaeus signatus Venom and Its Analogues: Structure-Activity Study and Synergistic Effect with Antibiotics
